head.title: Higher Order Structures Review and Assessment

body.p: In the body's organizational hierarchy, tissues occupy a place between cells and organs. That is, a tissue is a group of cells with a similar shape and function. In turn, organs (which make up the body) are comprised of various tissues. Broadly speaking, there are only four types of tissues: muscle tissue, nerve tissue, connective tissue and epithelial tissue.

An organ is made up of tissues that work together to perform a specific function for the body as a whole. Groups of organs that perform related functions are organized into organ systems, which perform more specific functions for the body as a whole.
